text:
I have some packages that I’ve registered, and they work with 1.5, but i have not yet had a chance to test them on 1.6 (which just got released).  How should I go about:
1. Testing it on 1.6, since presumably, if I try to add the package to 1.6, it will fail, since the `[compat]` only has 1.5
2. Once I have verified it works with 1.6 and pushed changes to the github repo, get the registry to be aware that it now works with 1.6

text:
1.6 is semver-compatible with 1.5, and the default for versions specified in `[compat]` is semver compatibility. So if you have e.g.
```[compat]
julia = "1.5"```
you're actually implicitly saying your package works on 1.5, 1.6, 1.7, ... but not 2.0.
